title: James 'Arg' Argent is in therapy for eating disorder
text:
Arg has cleared things up (Picture: Carla Speight/Getty Images)

James Argent has opened up on emergency services visiting him amid fears he had taken an overdose.

Earlier this month, the reality star’s on-off girlfriend Gemma Collins called emergency services with concerns over Arg’s welfare, after he failed to answer calls or messages from friends and family.

Arg has said that while he was safe, he understands why the GC was ‘seriously concerned’.

The 31-year-old claimed his phone was charging downstairs, while he couldn’t hear police knocking as he was on the third floor in his loft conversion.

Speaking to OK! magazine, Arg said: ‘I have put her through a lot so I completely understand her worry.

Arg says he understands why Gemma was concerned Picture: Karwai Tang/WireImage)

‘She remembers what she’s been through in the past with me so she thought the worst.’

The former Towie star explained that he had locked the door to the loft conversion as he gets nervous when alone in the house, adding: ‘[Emergency services] came up to my room – I was really shocked and confused. They had a five-minute chat with me and left.’

London Ambulance Services confirmed: ‘Police were called at 13.11hrs to a residential address following concerns for the welfare of male occupant. Officers attended with LAS. The male, in his 30s, was spoken to. He was left in the company of family.

‘Officers were called at 16.21hrs to the same address, again due to concerns for the same male’s welfare. The male declined assistance.’

Arg is addressing his issues with eating (Picture: Andy Barnes / BACKGRID)

This comes amid a difficult few months for Arg – he has split from Gemma, 38, while he was axed from Towie in May after failing a drugs test.

And Arg is in therapy to address his issues, including his eating disorder.

He said: ‘My biggest problem is my eating disorder. I have always struggled with it since my teens. When I’m in a bad place I binge eat, and when I put on weight it then triggers more issues.

‘I have been aware of the issue for a long time, but I still struggle with it so I’m speaking to my therapist about changing my relationship with my food.’

James has lost two stone through healthy eating and exercise, and now weighs 21.5 stone and wants to lose a further six stone.

Arg’s full interview is in this week’s OK! magazine, out on Tuesday.
